summary: This is a news summary document from the SDNY, dated January 10, 2020, containing a section on Jeffrey Epstein. It summarizes a New York Times article reporting on a Goodwin Procter law firm investigation into MIT's ties to Epstein, detailing his donations, visits, and the concealment efforts by university officials.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Disgraced financier and convicted sex offender
persons.context: The central subject of the article; a convicted sex offender who donated $850,000 to MIT, visited the campus, and whose connections are under investigation. He died by suicide in jail in August 2019.

persons.name: Seth Lloyd
persons.context: Placed on paid leave after the report found he 'purposefully failed' to inform MIT of multiple donations from Epstein, including a $60,000 gift deposited into a personal account.

persons.name: L. Rafael Reif
persons.context: Acknowledged signing a thank-you letter to Epstein in 2012. The report cleared him of wrongdoing, stating he was unaware the Media Lab was accepting Epstein's donations.

persons.name: Joichi Ito
persons.role: Former director of the MIT Media Lab
persons.context: Acknowledged raising $1.7 million from Epstein for the lab and his own funds. Internal emails showed he took steps to conceal the relationship. He resigned in September 2019.

persons.name: Bill Gates
persons.context: Mentioned in a 2014 email where Ito wrote a $2 million gift from Gates was 'directed by Jeffrey Epstein.' Gates's representatives denied Epstein directed his grant-making.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Mentioned in email exchanges where Ito discussed how Epstein was helping connect the Media Lab to Black. An email indicated Black had given the lab $4 million.

persons.name: Tiffany Hsu
persons.role: Journalist for The New York Times
persons.context: Co-author of the New York Times article summarized in this news clip.

persons.name: David Yaffe-Bellany
persons.role: Journalist for The New York Times
persons.context: Co-author of the New York Times article summarized in this news clip.

persons.name: Marc Tracy
persons.role: Journalist for The New York Times
persons.context: Co-author of the New York Times article summarized in this news clip.

connections.description: Epstein made donations, including a $60,000 gift deposited into Lloyd's personal bank account. Lloyd failed to inform MIT of these donations.
Epstein was a donor to the MIT Media Lab directed by Ito. Ito raised $1.7 million from Epstein and took steps to conceal their relationship.
Reif signed a thank-you letter to Epstein for a donation in 2012, though the report states he was unaware of the broader donation stream.
An email from Ito claimed a $2 million gift from Gates was 'directed by Jeffrey Epstein,' a claim Gates's representatives denied.
Epstein was reportedly helping to connect the MIT Media Lab to Leon Black for donations. An email indicated Black gave $4 million to the lab.
Ito discussed in emails how Epstein was helping connect the Media Lab to Black, who subsequently made a donation.

events.title: Epstein's Donations to MIT
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein made 10 donations totaling $850,000 to the Massachusetts Institute of Technology over a 15-year period.

events.title: Epstein's Visits to MIT
events.description: Epstein visited the MIT campus nine times between 2013 and 2017.

events.title: MIT Administrators Learn of Donations
events.description: Three current and former MIT administrators learned of Epstein's donations to the Media Lab but developed an 'informal framework' for approving further gifts.

events.title: MIT President Thanks Epstein
events.description: MIT President L. Rafael Reif signed a letter thanking Jeffrey Epstein for a donation, four years after Epstein's 2008 conviction.

events.title: Email on Gates Donation
events.description: In a 2014 email, Joichi Ito wrote that a $2 million gift from Bill Gates was 'directed by Jeffrey Epstein.'

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein killed himself in his Manhattan jail cell while awaiting trial on federal sex trafficking charges.

events.title: Joichi Ito Resigns
events.description: Joichi Ito resigned as director of the MIT Media Lab and from several other positions following disclosures about his fundraising from Epstein.

events.title: Release of Goodwin Procter Report
events.description: The law firm Goodwin Procter released its investigative report into MIT's ties with Jeffrey Epstein, detailing donations, visits, and administrative knowledge.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein donated a total of $850,000 to MIT in 10 gifts between 2002 and 2017 and visited the campus nine times from 2013 to 2017.
MIT professor Seth Lloyd was placed on paid leave for 'purposefully' failing to inform the university of Epstein donations, including a $60,000 gift deposited into his personal bank account.
Internal emails revealed MIT Media Lab director Joichi Ito and other officials took steps to conceal the lab's relationship with Epstein, including not naming him as the impetus for gifts.
An email from Ito claimed a $2 million donation from Bill Gates was 'directed by Jeffrey Epstein,' a claim Gates's representatives denied.
The investigative report found senior MIT administrators made 'significant mistakes of judgment' in accepting donations after Epstein's 2008 conviction but did not breach university policy.
